main event: A bright light was observed in St. Albans, West Virginia, in November 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared stationary for a while before moving straight up., The sighting lasted for 10-15 minutes., The weather conditions were clear during the observation., A follow-up record card mentioned a brilliant bright object moving southwest and disappearing behind a cloud., The conclusion for the second sighting suggested it could be a meteor or aircraft.
